Package contactsapp

Class Validate

java.lang.Object
contactsapp.Validate
public class Validate extends Object
Validate class contains various methods to validate strings of characters.

  • Constructor Details

    • Validate

      public Validate()

  • Method Details

    • name

      public static boolean name(String name)
      Validates name. Valid names can contain letters and optionally "-" and more letters.
      Parameters:
      name - Name to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if not.

    • phone

      public static boolean phone(String number)
      Validates phone number. Valid phone number starts with "+" and follows with 8-15 numbers.
      Parameters:
      number - String of numbers to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if not.

    • email

      public static boolean email(String email)
      Validates email. First part of the email can contain letters, numbers and some special characters. followed by @ and another set of letters including "." and "-" for the domain name. followed by "." and string of characters for the TLD.
      Parameters:
      email - String of characters to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if not.

    • address

      public static boolean address(String address)
      Validates address. Street address can contain letters, spaces and "-". Followed by space and street number and optionally apartment. Followed by space and 5 digit postal code. Followed by space and city name.
      Parameters:
      address - String of characters to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if not.

    • id

      public static boolean id(String id)
      Validates finnish id. Id starts with date of birth in format of day/month/year eq. 11/03/99. Followed by century symbol. Followed by 3 digits. Followd by a letter in a list of 31 letters. Picked by putting date and 3 digits together and % 31.
      Parameters:
      id - String of charaters to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if not.
